author: James Xu
description: “State Organs: Unmasking Transplant Abuse in China,” an award-winning documentary on China’s forced organ harvesting operations, held its first UK screening at London Shepherd Church on Oct. 11. The film exposes a “harrowing government-run organ harvesting operation” in China, according to its website. The production team spent seven years gathering evidence and interviewing families of […]
title: Film ‘State Organs’ Screens in London, Highlighting Transplant Abuse in China

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The joint Albanese–Malinauskas plan pledges major investment in science, reef restoration, and real-time monitoring.
title: $102.5 Million Plan to Rebuild SA’s Marine Life After 400 Species Lost to Algae

author: Stacy Robinson
description: The downfall of the island nation's leader follows weeks of protests by a group calling itself 'Gen Z Madagascar.'
title: Madagascar’s President Ousted, Military Seizes Control of Government

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Beijing bars the Dutch-owned chipmaker from exporting China-made components, intensifying a dispute over control of semiconductor supply chains.
title: China Blocks Nexperia Exports Amid Dutch Move to Seize Control of Chipmaker

author: Andrew Moran
description: 'I’m with this man because his philosophy is correct,' Trump told reporters.
title: Trump Says $20 Billion Aid for Argentina Depends on a Milei Election Victory

author: Noé Chartier
description: The Bloc Québécois has made public its list of demands to the minority Liberal government to gain the party’s support for the upcoming budget, saying six of those are make-or-break. Bloc MP Jean-Denis Garon presented 18 demands from his party on Oct. 14 at a press conference in Ottawa. Among the six demands that he […]
title: Bloc Québécois Issues 6 ‘Unavoidable’ Budget Demands to Minority Liberals

author: Ryan Morgan
description: 'Intelligence confirmed the vessel was trafficking narcotics, was associated with illicit narcoterrorist networks,' the president said.
title: Trump Announces 5th US Strike on Drug Boat Near Venezuela

author: Mary Prenon
description: The EU alleges that all three companies were involved in resale price maintenance, preventing independent retailers from setting their own prices.
title: Gucci, Chloé, Loewe Face Multimillion-Euro EU Fines for Pricing Practices

author: The Canadian Press
description: A newly released spy watchdog report says the Canadian Security Intelligence Service lacked adequate policies and procedures to manage a secret technology for collecting information. The National Security and Intelligence Review Agency says CSIS mischaracterized a novel technical capability as an extension of existing know-how. The report says this led to CSIS not consulting Public […]
title: CSIS Lacked Proper Policies, Procedures to Manage New Secret Technology: Spy Watchdog

author: Harry Ho-jen Tseng
description: Commentary The following is an excerpt from a speech given by Ambassador Harry Tseng, Representative of Taipei Economic and Cultural Office in Canada, at a reception marking Taiwan’s 114th National Day, observed on Oct. 10, at the Fairmont Château Laurier in Ottawa on Oct. 7, 2025. I am sure many of you would agree that […]
title: Taiwan National Day: Forging On and Never Giving Up

author: Olivia Gomm
description: An explosion at a building under construction in Toronto on Oct. 14 has left seven people injured, four of whom were taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries, officials say. Fire crews were dispatched just before 9:30 a.m. to a high-rise building under construction near Esther Shiner Boulevard and Provost Drive in the Leslie Street and […]
title: 7 People in Hospital After Explosion at Toronto Construction Site

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Vancouver police have arrested a suspect in a series of “unprovoked” stabbings and assaults in the city’s Yaletown neighbourhood on Oct. 10. Seven random attacks occurred in the early morning hours of Oct. 10 near David Lam Park along the Yaletown seawall, leaving victims with non-life-threatening injuries, police said in a statement on Oct. 12. […]
title: Police Arrest Suspect in Vancouver Stabbings as Victim Count Rises to 7

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Four people have been charged in connection with an “elaborate” opium poppy-growing operation in northeast Edmonton, police say. Edmonton police said in an Oct. 14 statement that a search warrant had been executed at a property in July, where approximately 60,000 opium poppy plants were found growing behind the residence. The plants have a total […]
title: Edmonton Police Seize 60,000 Opium Poppy Plants From Property

author: Crystal-Rose Jones, Daniel Y. Teng
description: 'For two hours, everything else goes away, you just are so focused ... It is so good it's almost a meditation,' says watercolourist Anne Maree O'Brien.
title: As Postmodernism Embraces Fervour, This Artist Finds Meditation in Every Precise Stroke

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Jamieson Greer says the outcome hinges on Beijing's next move, with Washington accusing China of weaponizing minerals and destabilizing markets.
title: Trade Rep Says Trump May Fast-Track 100 Percent Tariff If China Escalates Rare Earth Fight

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Conservatives have launched a petition to end diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) criteria for government funding, saying merit-based prioritization and fiscal discipline should be restored instead. The petition calls for an end to DEI metrics for government funding and supports the Conservative’s plan to “restore fiscal discipline, end the billion-dollar DEI bureaucracies, and put […]
title: Tories Push Petition to End DEI Criteria for Government Funding

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal housing minister wouldn’t commit Tuesday to a Liberal election campaign promise to push cities to cut the fees that help fund local infrastructure. In Toronto for an announcement, Housing Minister Gregor Robertson did not answer directly when asked whether the Liberals are still committed to their promise to cut municipal development charges in […]
title: Housing Minister Won’t Commit to Liberal Election Promise to Cut Development Fees

author: The Canadian Press
description: BCE Inc. will begin offering fibre internet services in Western Canada using its rivals’ networks under rules it has long opposed, as it seeks to grow its customer base and push for more bundled subscriptions. That was among a list of plans shared by the parent company of Bell Canada during its investor day event […]
title: Bell to Resell Fibre Internet in Western Canada as It Announces Three-Year Outlook

author: The Canadian Press
description: A group representing Quebec universities is reporting that international student enrolment has dropped sharply compared to last year. Preliminary data from the Bureau de coopération interuniversitaire indicates that enrolment for the current fall session has plummeted by more than 21 percent at the master’s level and by 12.1 percent overall. The sharpest drops were among […]
title: International Enrolment at Quebec Universities Drops Over 12 per Cent, Report Says

author: Dorothy Li
description: The sanction against five U.S.-linked subsidiaries of Hanwha was imposed on the same day Beijing and Washington implemented port fees on each other's ships.
title: China Targets South Korean Shipbuilder Hanwha Over US Probe

author: Noé Chartier
description: As part of the process of rebuilding ties between Ottawa and New Delhi, Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand said the two capitals have agreed to return to previous levels of diplomatic staffing. Anand made the comment while speaking to reporters from Mumbai on Oct. 14, a day after meeting in New Delhi with Indian Prime […]
title: Canada, India Agree to Increase Diplomatic Staffing Levels: Minister Anand

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Nearly 90 percent of Canadians across generational, geographic, and political lines are concerned about the state of housing in the country, a new survey suggests. Eighty-seven percent of the 3,900 adults polled last month say they are worried about affordability and availability of housing in Canada. The survey conducted by Abacus Data in collaboration with […]
title: 9 in 10 Canadians Say They’re Worried About Housing in Canada: Poll

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Liberal government’s bill targeting hate crimes is not meant to regulate the internet, but it would apply to some online content that involves the “wilful promotion of hatred,” according to Justice Minister Sean Fraser. “Generally speaking, the law will apply equally online as it does in real communities… just in the limited circumstances where […]
title: Bill C-9 on Hate Crimes Would Apply to Online Content: Justice Minister Fraser

author: Jacob Burg
description: Trump said the United States had given Hamas approval to police the Gaza Strip 'for a period of time.'
title: What to Know About the Armed Groups, Clans Challenging Hamas in Gaza

author: Epoch Video
description: President Donald Trump welcomes Argentinian President Javier Milei to the White House at 1 p.m. ET on Oct. 14 for a bilateral summit.
title: LIVE NOW: Trump Welcomes Argentinian President Milei to White House

author: Noé Chartier
description: Canada’s military is preparing a new policy that will dictate what its chaplains are allowed to say, or whether they can lead prayer, during military ceremonies. The Canadian Armed Forces banned prayers by chaplains in public settings in 2023, replacing them instead with “spiritual reflections,” but committed to creating a new policy following backlash. The […]
title: Chaplain Prayer Ban During Ceremonies: Canadian Military Preparing New Policy

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The U.S. Treasury chief says Beijing is showing economic weakness and wants to 'pull everybody else down with them.'
title: China’s Rare Earth Export Controls Aim to Damage Global Economy: Bessent

author: Guy Birchall
description: Fayaz Khan, who entered the UK illegally on a small boat, made the threat against the Reform UK leader in a TikTok post in October 2024.
title: Illegal Immigrant Who Threatened to Kill Nigel Farage Jailed for 5 Years

author: The Canadian Press
description: Shoppers who made online purchases through Canadian Tire Corp. Ltd. may have had their personal information compromised. The retailer said Monday that it identified a data breach on Oct. 2 involving information stored in its e-commerce database. The breached information belongs to shoppers who had an e-commerce account with Canadian Tire or its other banners, […]
title: Canadian Tire Says Recent Breach of E-commerce Database Involved Customer Info

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: U.S. President Donald Trump used a seemingly joking reference to the term “governor” with Prime Minister Mark Carney during a recent summit of global leaders in Egypt. Trump said his error in addressing Carney as “president” during his speech was significantly better than referring to him as a “governor,” as he had called Carney’s predecessor […]
title: Trump-Carney Hot Mic in Egypt: ‘At Least I Didn’t Call You Governor’

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Twenty living Israeli hostages reunited with their families after 738 days in Hamas captivity.
title: The 20 Israeli Hostages Released Under Trump’s Gaza Peace Deal

author: Frank Fang
description: ‘We stand with our Philippine allies as they confront China’s dangerous actions which undermine regional stability,’ says a State Department spokesperson.
title: US Condemns China’s Ramming of Philippine Vessel in South China Sea

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The move comes days after the Norwegian Nobel Committee awarded the Nobel Peace Prize to Venezuelan opposition politician María Corina Machado.
title: Venezuela Shuts Embassies in Norway, Australia

author: Guy Birchall
description: The ban will come into force on Dec. 10 and prohibit anyone under the age of 16 from setting up an account on social media.
title: Australia Promotes Impending Social Media Ban: ‘For the Good of Our Kids’

author: Chris Summers
description: Lawmakers are being warned of attempts to gain information through phishing attacks,  blackmail, and by cultivation of long-term personal relationships.
title: MI5 Warns UK Politicians of Targeting by Spies From China, Russia, Iran

author: Owen Evans
description: Arrests for speech offenses are rising while convictions fall, which means that police are becoming overzealous in policing social media, says Lord Young.
title: Worried About Free Speech in Britain? There’s a Union for That

author: Eva Fu, Frank Fang
description: The Chinese intelligence officer met a Taiwanese soldier through a dating app.
title: Chinese Spy Impersonated Epoch Times Reporter in Taiwan Plot: Prosecutors

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Anniversary reignites debate over race, unity, and unfinished reform
title: 2 Years On, The Voice Still Divides

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Support for violence is strongest at the left and right ends of the political spectrum.
title: Rising Number of New Zealanders Believe Violence Necessary to Solve Country’s Problems

author: Alfred Bui
description: Senator Dean Smith also raised questions over why a 2030 estimate of climate damage—just 5 years away—was not included.
title: Climate Agency Concedes It Did Not Scrutinise Data Behind Major Climate Risk Report

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: Former Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Trump’s Gaza peace deal was based on the Biden administration’s framework.
title: Biden Commends Trump’s Gaza Deal

author: AAP
description: A man who held a gun at two people’s heads in violent carjackings again raised his weapon at innocent bystanders as he ran from police during a wild pursuit. Tactical officers swarmed Melbourne’s city centre on Tuesday morning with unmarked police cars blocking Spring Street near Victoria’s parliament. Witnesses watched as heavily armed police raced […]
title: Gunman’s Wild, Violent Crime Spree Ends in Hotel Lobby

author: PA Media
description: Around 300,000 people have protested against proposals to make changes to the way drugs are approved for NHS use. Last week it was reported that the health service in England may need to pay more for medicines under plans to stave off tariffs threatened by US President Donald Trump. Politico said proposals, including raising the […]
title: Almost 300,000 Protest Against Pushing up NHS Drug Prices

author: PA Media
description: Heathrow airport’s passenger numbers have grown by just 0.3 percent so far this year because of capacity constraints. Figures from the UK’s busiest airport show 63.3 million passengers travelled through its four terminals between January and September. That is only 200,000 more than during the same month last year, as its two runways are being […]
title: Heathrow’s 2025 Passenger Numbers Growth Just 0.3 Percent Amid Capacity Constraints

author: PA Media
description: The European Union’s ambassador to the UK has defended planned hikes in steel tariffs as officials in Whitehall attempted to limit the potentially catastrophic impact on British workers. The European Commission has disclosed plans to impose 50% tariffs on steel, double the current level of 25%, while cutting tariff-free import volumes to 18.3 million tons […]
title: EU Ambassador Defends Looming Steel Tariffs Amid Talks on Protecting UK Industry

author: PA Media
description: Scotland’s Deputy First Minister has urged the Chancellor to scrap and replace the windfall tax on oil and gas at the next Budget. Rachel Reeves will lay out the UK Government’s tax and spending plans next month, but the energy profits levy – which levels a tax on the profits of oil and gas firms […]
title: Forbes Calls for Windfall Tax to Be Replaced at the Coming Budget

author: Cindy Li
description: SA lobster exports have more than doubled over the past year.
title: South Australia Lobster Exports Hits Record High After Beijing Lifted Trade Ban

author: PA Media
description: Car manufacturers decided they would “rather cheat than comply with the law” over vehicle emissions, the High Court has heard, in what is the biggest legal action of its kind in English history. Around 1.6 million motorists are taking legal action against more than a dozen manufacturers over claims that several diesel vehicles made from […]
title: Car Makers ‘Would Rather Cheat Than Follow Law’ Over Emissions, High Court Told

author: PA Media
description: HS2 Ltd has completed the digging of major tunnels on its route between Birmingham and west London. The company building the high-speed railway said a tunnel boring machine (TBM) broke through at Washwood Heath, north-east Birmingham, on Monday after an 18-month journey to create the Bromford Tunnel. The twin-bore tunnel stretches 3.5 miles to near […]
title: HS2 Digs Final Deep Tunnel Between Birmingham and West London

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Ceasefire hailed as breakthrough as hostages return home and nations pledge to end extremism.
title: Australian Leaders Praise Trump’s Middle East Peace Deal

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: A joint letter to the health minister calls for tougher oversight amid reports of coercion and patient harm.
title: Doctors, Pharmacists Urge Crackdown on Unchecked Cannabis Prescriptions

author: The Associated Press
description: TORONTO—Julio Rodríguez and Jorge Polanco hit three-run homers, Josh Naylor added a two-run drive and the Seattle Mariners took a 2-0 AL Championship Series lead by routing the Toronto Blue Jays 10-3 on Monday. Seattle, the only big league team never to host a World Series game, headed home for Wednesday’s Game 3 needing two […]
title: Mariners Take 2-0 ALCS Lead, Beat Blue Jays 10-3 as Rodríguez, Polanco and Naylor Homer

author: The Associated Press
description: STOCKHOLM—Three researchers who probed the process of business innovation won the Nobel memorial prize in economics Monday for explaining how new products and inventions promote economic growth and human welfare, even as they leave older companies in the dust. Their work was credited with helping economists better understand how ideas and technology succeed by disrupting […]
title: Nobel Economics Prize Goes to 3 Researchers for Explaining Innovation-Driven Economic Growth
